subject: Public Speaking
title: Garibaldi's Call to Arms in Italy
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Garibaldi's Call to Arms in Italy.

hook.text: In 1849, Garibaldi's army was defeated in Rome. He offered his followers hunger, thirst, and more fighting.

buildup.text: His speech promised nothing but hardship. No pay, no shelter, no glory â€” just the cause of Italian unity.

discovery.text: Thousands followed him anyway. The honesty of the offer made it more compelling than any promise of reward.

twist.text: Most leaders sell hope. Garibaldi sold sacrifice â€” and people found that more authentic and inspiring.

climax.text: His approach proved that transparency about cost can be more motivating than inflated promises of gain.

punchline.text: He promised nothing and got everything.

quiz.question: What made Garibaldi's speech to his followers unusual?
options: He offered only hardship and sacrifice, with no rewards
